verses.text: To you, O LORD, I lift up my soul;
in you I trust, O my God. Do not let me be put to shame, nor let my enemies triumph over me.
No one whose hope is in you will ever be put to shame, but they will be put to shame who are treacherous without excuse.
Show me your ways, O LORD, teach me your paths;

rsbNotes.title: Ps 25
rsbNotes.text: Ps. 25 This acrostic psalm is primarily the lament of an individual (vv. 16–21), but the last verse applies it to the community. Covenantal (v. 10) and wisdom (vv. 4, 5) language pervade the poem.

verses.text: guide me in your truth and teach me, for you are God my Savior, and my hope is in you all day long.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 25:5
rsbNotes.text: 25:5 See “Understanding the Word of God” at 119:34.

verses.text: Remember, O LORD, your great mercy and love, for they are from of old.
Remember not the sins of my youth and my rebellious ways; according to your love remember me, for you are good, O LORD.
Good and upright is the LORD; therefore he instructs sinners in his ways.
He guides the humble in what is right and teaches them his way.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 25:6–7
rsbNotes.text: 25:6, 7 Remember . . . mercy . . . steadfast love. These words are all closely connected with God’s covenant, which is the basis of the psalmist’s trust.

verses.text: All the ways of the LORD are loving and faithful for those who keep the demands of his covenant.
For the sake of your name, O LORD, forgive my iniquity, though it is great.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 25:10
rsbNotes.text: 25:10 his covenant and his testimonies. His revealed will for our lives; that is, the law.

verses.text: Who, then, is the man that fears the LORD? He will instruct him in the way chosen for him.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 25:12
rsbNotes.text: 25:12 fears the Lord. Cf. Prov. 1:7 and Eccl. 12:13. The fear of the Lord is reverence and awe toward God, not life-disrupting anxiety. Also, see note Ps. 111:10.

verses.text: He will spend his days in prosperity, and his descendants will inherit the land.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 25:13
rsbNotes.text: 25:13 inherit the land. The blessings and curses of Deut. 27; 28 make it clear that Israel will keep the land given them by God if they remain faithful to the conditions of the covenant (cf. v. 10).

verses.text: The LORD confides in those who fear him; he makes his covenant known to them.
My eyes are ever on the LORD, for only he will release my feet from the snare.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 25:14
rsbNotes.text: 25:14 makes known to them his covenant. Each time Abraham doubted God’s ability to fulfill the promises of Gen. 12:1–3, God appeared to him and renewed the covenant (Gen. 15 and 17).
